intro: Lilium glabrum, commonly known as the Western fawn lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features grass-like, glabrous (smooth) leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
